comment.body: 新版本如果能优化内存就太棒了

@Quantumworld: that's true. kde eats up tons of calculation to work.
i3 may be hard to use at first, but when you get used to it, you'll love it
i'm using kde + debian and i3 + freebsd on two PCs at home and i'm using debian(chroot) + lxqt on my android phone
i've tried putting zn in vhd on windows because windows does really bad in processing a large number of small files

i think these problems do happen.
these data will stay in the network until no one seeds it anymore. however, there are "seed-me" services like [this](/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n), which means that these data will stay in the network not for years, but forever

names wont run out, there are 36^16 names on zeroid.bit in total, even if it really runns out, we still have kxoid, however, short or not-meaningless ids do run out, for example, 0@zeroid.bit ~ 59@zeroid.bit are all taken and i've never seen them
@Quantumworld: however, when the seed-me services eventually goes down, these data still will cease to exsist (and that's why i'm planning to dump my proxy server into a git repo)
@leftside: that's quite true. also that's why more services like kxoid or kaffie hub should be used
@Pubg: however, that link seems not to be working. it seems that zerome dont treat ip6 addresses as links.
貌似最近一阵子zn被针对了
